org.livingdoc.converters.color

Class ColorConverter

  • org.livingdoc.converters.color.ColorConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TypeConverter<T>

    public class ColorConverter
implements TypeConverter<T>

    A class containing methods, that can convert a string to a hex color value.

    • Field Detail

        A class containing methods, that can convert a string to a hex color value.

    • Method Detail

      • canConvertTo

        public boolean canConvertTo(@Nullable
                            java.lang.Class<?> targetType)

      • convert

        @NotNull
public java.lang.String convert(@Nullable
                                         java.lang.String value,
                                         @Nullable
                                         java.lang.reflect.AnnotatedElement element,
                                         @Nullable
                                         java.lang.Class<?> documentClass)

        Converts a given string to a lower case hex color value string. This method throws a @throws ColorFormatException if the given string is not valid color value. In the context of this function valid color values, that can be converted are hex color values e.g. #66ff33, pre-defined color names in a property file e.g. blue, or rgb color values e.g. rgb(0,191,255).

        Parameters:
        value -

        • the string to be converted

        element -
        documentClass -
        Returns:
        A lower case hex color value as a string.
